intro: Spermacoce dussii, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or small starfruit, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to reveal several small, hard seeds. Spermacoce dussii is often found in moist, shaded environments and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
